articles.title: Minju Joson Ridicules Press Conference on Iraqi Situation
Repeal of Troop Dispatch to Iraq Demanded
Abolition of "Law on Supervision for Public Peace" Urged
Abrogation of "Security Law" Demanded
articles.content:
Abolition of "Law on Supervision for Public Peace" Urged 
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification reportedly made public a statement on December 1, denouncing the security authorities for arresting again Kim Tae Won who had visited the north as a representative of the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils, on charge of violating the "law on supervision for public peace".
 The statement said that the law which requires a released convict to report to a relevant police station about his whereabouts and his activities regularly is an anti-human rights evil law. It urged the security authorities to abrogate the evil law and set free Kim Tae Won immediately.    
 The Family Movement for Realizing Democracy also issued a statement titled "Immediately abolish the law on supervision for public peace, an evil law against human rights" on November 3

articles.title: Lao Diplomats Visit International Friendship Exhibition
"Day of Korea" Marked
articles.content:
Lao Diplomats Visit International Friendship Exhibition 
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- Staff members of the Lao embassy here including Chanpheng Sihaphom, Lao ambassador to the DPRK, visited the International Friendship Exhibition on Dec. 4 on the occasion of the 28th anniversary of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
 They paid tribute to the statue of President Kim Il Sung in humble reverence.    
 They looked round with keen interest gifts Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il received from party and state leaders and political and public figures of many countries.

Congratulatory Message to Congress of Angolan Political Party
Kim Il Chol Meets Delegation of Vietnamese Ministry of Defense
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Congress of Angolan Political Party
    Pyongyang, December 5 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea sent a congratulatory message to the 5th Congress of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola on Dec. 5.
 The message noted that the congress would mark an important occasion to consolidate the successes gained in the struggle to achieve the peace of the country the further strengthen the movement under the leadership of the Popular Liberation Movement of Angola.    
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would continue to develop on good terms in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, it sincerely wished the movement great success in the work of the congress.
